content.rendered:
What is a Data Scientist?

Data Scientists use quantitative or qualitative information to understand given outcomes. They utilize data visualization softwares to interpret data and spot trends in a wide variety of industries.

Where does a Data Scientist work?

  • Tech companies
  • Engineering companies
  • Software companies

How much does a Data Scientist make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Data Scientist is $92,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Data Scientists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Computer science majors
  • Software engineering majors
  • General engineering majors
Search Data Scientist jobs on Handshake

Data Scientist skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Data Scientists succeed in their work:

  • High attention to detail
  • Knowledge of relevant softwares
  • Teamwork and collaboration

What are some common questions about Data Scientists?

Q: How do I get a job in data science?

A: Check out tips and tricks for all things data science related here!

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming a Data Scientist.
